author: Scott Wohl

review: Is it perfect? Not quite, but that's the beauty of Google's product development, in that they consistently look to improve upon their product.  Really, the only thing keeping this from being a five star review is the app support, which will grow in the coming months now that Google has released the SDK to other developers.Setting up Chromecast is very simple, and you're always greeted by a nice visual background on the interface which cycles to change things up (and probably prevent burn-in on old plasmas and LCDs).  Where the device excels is in choosing your content to stream (cast) to the tv.  I can select a track from Google Play Music on my phone, and then pop between Netflix, HBO Go, etc to find something to watch without interrupting playing.  You can also keep browsing for other content while streaming a movie from one of the aforementioned services (something I can't do on my Apple TV).Also, like Airplay on iOS devices for AppleTV, it works for a good music hub if you're entertaining guests or just hanging around the house, only unlike AppleTV, Chromecast is supported on both Android and iOS (I'd imagine WP8 support will come down the road).All in all, Google's off to a good start here.  Now that the SDK is open to other developers outside of their initial pool, I'm looking forward to who all else jumps on board, and what other content Google tries to push, themselves.But when considering the cross platform functionality, you can't beat this thing for the price they ask.  I highly recommend getting it.
